key_title: Key to the species of Lythrum

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Lythraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Lythraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant decumbent or erect, tips of branches rising to 60 cm, glabrous or minutely scabrous; leaves mostly alternate; petals less than 8 mm long
Plant erect, to 1.5 m tall, glabrous or pubescent; leaves mostly opposite; petals 8–10 mm long
Flowers in clusters of 1–7 in leaf axils; stems usually erect to ascending, often woody at base
Flowers solitary in leaf axils; decumbent to ascending herbs
Petals 1–4 mm long, hypanthium without reddish spots near base, appendages 1–1.5 mm long
Petals 4–6 mm long, hypanthium with a ring of reddish spots near base, appendages to 1 mm long
